page.title: 10FISHERMEN
page.content: WE INTERVIEWED 10 FISHERMEN, 10 FULL TIME, ALTHOUGH 2 HAVE NOW GIVEN UP.THEY THEY LIKE THEIR TIME OFF,THE VARIETY OF WORK AND THE SATISFACTION OF A BIG CATCH AND GOOD PAY. DISLIKES WERE ROUGH WEATHER AND EARLY RISING. ON AVERAGE THEY HAD BEEN WORKING FOR 19 YEARS. OTHER JOBS THEY MIGHT HAVE LIKED WERE MOSTLY PRACTICAL WITH FOUR CHOOSING THE MERCHANT NAVY. MOST FISHERMEN GET UP BETWEEN MIDNIGHT AND 5 A.M. IN SUMMER AND 3 A.M. AND 6 A.M. IN WINTER. MOSTLY THEY CATCH HADDOCK, WHITING, LING, PLAICE, SKATE, HERRING AND SAND EELS. THEY ALL LIKE TO EAT SOME OF WHAT THEY CATCH AND HADDOCK SEEMS TO BE THE FAVOURITE. PROBLEMS OF THE JOB ARE LACK OF SLEEP, BAD WEATHER AND NO FISH. DANGERS ARE GETTING TANGLED IN EQUIPMENT, FALLING OVERBOARD AND BAD WEATHER. OPINION WAS THAT BOATS WOULD GET BIGGER IN FUTURE.
